item.description:
akabillposters:

not sure enough people here would understand what (good) product managers do and don’t do to necessarily get the sarcasm.

Oh right, I should spell it out

Hacker Noon – 21 May 17

WHAT MAKES A GREAT PRODUCT MANAGER – Hacker Noon

Intro

Reading time: 10 min read

Harvard Business Review – 13 Dec 17

What It Takes to Become a Great Product Manager

And how to pick between jobs.

khoslaventures.com

Good_Product_Manager_Bad_Product_Manager_KV.pdf

116.54 KB

And a select quote… “Bad product managers cut corners on communication…”

item.title: New Subscription Sounds - June?

item.description:
Reaper2.0:

Than why wouldn’t he say so?

Because informing your customers about new and upcoming things for your product clearly isn’t something any good product manager and default public relations manager should do.

crystldawnmusic:

An update that is so important, that he can’t spare a minute or two to let us know?

Exactly. Then again we weren’t really made aware of what 5.1 would even be including, let alone 5 save for the few who saw the leaked content firsthand.

item.title: New Subscription Sounds - June?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Yeah I don’t disagree, for sure. It’s real easy - if something is free then we (anyone, any product) have no real right to any kind of anything.

Any kind of paid thing, whether one time (usually a time limited warranty of some sort) or especially recurring should have some sort of support / communication / correspondence. If I pay for a service, and I’m not happy with it, I take my money elsewhere. Pretty much what it boils down to.

Read full topic

item.title: New Subscription Sounds - June?

item.description:

issue with the lack of communication

Totally. All of the social media has sort of been cut off as well.

Read full topic

item.title: New Subscription Sounds - June?
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
DHO:

The devs aren’t necessarily obligated to add a sound pack this month as we already got the drums, so I think it’s safe to assume no sounds this month.

iammane:

Yeah I don’t recall seeing “two every month” written anywhere. It is what it is.

Agreed on this, but I personally have an issue with the lack of communication. To me, it sometimes feels like we are paying a subscription for Half Life 3 in a way, and that may seem like an exaggeration but when the developers prioritize their already limited interaction to a select group only some of the time, it can easily feel like they aren’t present at all. That’s what I hope to see changed in the future, but I’m definitely not holding my breath, as that isn’t good for my health.

Read full topic

item.title: New Subscription Sounds - June?
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
It’s unlikely to come out today, so instead let’s give the developer’s the benefit of the doubt here. Sure, it would only take a few minutes to let your upset customers know what’s going on and promise something next month, but they’re busy handling everything themselves and not letting people help them instead. So rather than be upset, let’s just look forward to whatever July has to offer for us.

And yes I know that may sound a bit sarcastic but really nothing short of a miracle is likely to change how they handle things, so moving on is the only sure way to handle things. That or leaving entirely, which right now isn’t something I am entirely interested in.

Read full topic

item.title: New Subscription Sounds - June?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
TheRealJFalc:

Auxy really needs a PR team

Nah. For a company (and userbase/user community) this small, community comms/engagement is only a part-time thing — 2–3hrs each week (assuming they’re both full-time on Auxy*).
It’s something that should be well within the existing team’s capabilities.

(* As mentioned, I get the impression that they might not be working on Auxy full-time at the moment.)

When the team is that small, which is often the case with startups, team members are typically required to cover multiple roles (with primary responsibility – ‘ownership’ – for at least one task/function).
PR/community engagement, etc… should be well within Lenberg’s capabilities/responsibilities. He’ll certainly be directly handling business partnerships as that was part of his role at SC. It’s not the same things as user engagement/community management, but the fact that Lenberg’s more present here than Fredrik, it’s a role that’s seemingly on Lenberg’s desk.

Read full topic

item.title: New Subscription Sounds - June?
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
DJ_La_Rocca:

it needs a good driver and a reliable driver. Ie: the developers

Auxy Community: GIVE US CHIPTUNES

Lenberg: DON’T MAKE ME TURN THIS CAR AROUND!

On a more serious note, they need to put a much better effort into handling the community. As @Arimyth pointed out, Auxy really needs a PR team, someone who will professionally handle business relations such as this. Otherwise we could have another Niantic here.

Read full topic

item.title: New Subscription Sounds - June?
item.dc:creator: DJ_La_Rocca
item.description:
Maybe they’ve kinda stopped putting effort in seing that they are getting money from our shbscriptions. But if he wants us to keep our subscriptions they’ve gotta continue putting in effort and acknowledging our time and effort that us as a community spend to give them ideas on how to improve the app. Auxy is going to a good destination but for it to achieve a good arrival and to continue the destination, it needs a good driver and a reliable driver. Ie: the developers
